result.execSummary:
The defendant Andrea Mary Cloud-Jones was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs and fees by October 16, 2017, or to be docketed as a civil judgment. Court ordered non-mandatory costs WAIVED.
Court ordered restitution set at $0 (zero).

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrea Mary Cloud-Jones

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Sentencing proceeded. Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law. Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court ordered defendant to serve 15 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to case #15CM2424 and to any other sentence, with credit for 0 (zero) days time served. The Court granted Huber privileges, pursuant to 303.08 Wis. Stats. for inmate work at House of Corrections, treatment and UWM Program ONLY:

Court ordered defendant to pay all mandatory court costs and fees by October 16, 2017, or to be docketed as a civil judgment. Court ordered non-mandatory costs WAIVED.

Court ordered restitution set at $0 (zero).

Filed;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.

Defendant Andrea Mary Cloud-Jones in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Defendant Andrea Mary Cloud-Jones in custody.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

AS TO COUNT 1:

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the criminal complaint and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Andrea Mary Cloud-Jones not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: dds.

Matter calendared for Plea and sentencing.  Parties informed that Branch 37 is in jury trial and unable to hear this matter on today; adjourned date selected.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Andrea Mary Cloud-Jones not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. For reasons stated on the record, Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 26, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Program Discharge Summary report dated July 16, 2015; received and filed.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC.
Justice Point Program violation report; received and filed. Court reviewed violation and no action at this time, will be addressed with defense counsel at today's proceedings. Deputy Court Clerk: TC.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Andrea Mary Cloud-Jones not in court, in custody.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defense is awaiting portions of discovery and is requesting time for defendant to complete treatment. Court ordered case adjourned for projected guilty plea and sentencing in Branch 37. Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Andrea Mary Cloud-Jones not in court, in custody.  Alex T. Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.   
Defense counsel has received discovery and offer.  Any and all motions are to be filed with the court by the final pretrial date.    Case is adjourned for projected plea hearing in Branch 37.  Plea hearing scheduled for May 7, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION INCLUDING DRUG TESTING.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with PICK N SAVE - N. 35TH ST
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Andrea Mary Cloud-Jones in court with attorney Brian Christopher Hagner.  Defendant Andrea Mary Cloud-Jones in custody.  Brandon A Wigley appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dee, Branch 37.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 1, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
